definition: shade (of a color, i.e. light or dark)
insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen

sentences.english: I like to look at the tints of pink in the sky at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡看黎明時天空中濃淡不同的粉澀。

sentences.english: The English drinks the tea shade to be to each their own, but the general love adds the milk in the tea soup.
sentences.chinese: 英國人飲茶濃淡各有所好，但一般愛在茶湯中加牛奶。

sentences.english: Deep color, glaze does not flow does not crack, even tone shades.
sentences.chinese: 色澤深沉，釉面不流不裂，色調濃淡均勻。

sentences.english: Soil thin purple veins, quality is quite thin, varying shades of color green.
sentences.chinese: 土脈細紫，質頗薄，色青濃淡不一。

sentences.english: Shades affordable woman, must have the cloud in the blue sky of water in the bottle of wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 濃淡相宜的女人，要有云在青天水在瓶的智慧。

sentences.english: We have this rose color. We also have different shades of beige.
sentences.chinese: 我們有這種玫瑰色，還有各種濃淡的灰褐色。

sentences.english: The picture was painted in several tints of green.
sentences.chinese: 這幅畫是用數種濃淡不同的綠色畫成的。

sentences.english: This is especially significant when you consider how dark a block of text looks.
sentences.chinese: 這對於一整塊文字的濃淡效果來說尤其明顯。

definition: deep or shallow/depth (of the sea)/limits of decorum
to blend into one another/to blend together well
what is true and what is false/(to get to know) the real situation
to smudge (become smeared)/to smudge (create a blurred effect)/shading (wash painting technique)
vein lines (in marble or fingerprint)/grain (in wood etc)
to touch up (a piece of writing)/to add details (to a painting)
venation (pattern of veins on a leaf)
thick and thin/coarse and fine/thickness (caliber)/coarseness/quality of work
brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
